page.title: 13Flash Loyal Union Society
page.content: {The Flash Loyal Union Society } started in 1846, 139 years ago. It is a club when, if any one is sick and they can't go to work, they pay the person who is sick 60p a week. Before they receive the money, they have to say{"Dear Brother (or sister), it has {pleased God to afflict me so serverly {with (here mention the complaint) {that I am incapable of following my {usual employment."}When the person is better then they say to the male (or female) vistor of Flash Loyal Union society, Buxton{"Dear Brother (or {sister,) through the blessing of God I {am so far recovered as to be inclined {for the present to give up our {society's sick allowance."}
